This User’s Guide describes the process of working with distribution routes using the dxMobile application on an Android device. It is intended for TForce Independent Contractors (ICs) who are responsible for delivering packages associated with distribution routes (routes that start at the depot and have multiple drop-off locations).
Your Android device is used, in conjunction with dxMobile, to record barcode scans when packages are received, loaded onto vehicles, and picked up or delivered to their destination.
The minimum requirements to run the dxMobile for Android application are listed below:
​ Screen resolution - 480 x 800 or above
​ OS - version 5.0 or above
​ WIFI and Bluetooth connection
​ Google Maps
​ An Android phone withoutFix Focus. We do not recommend using a phone with Fix Focus, because the scanning feature using the internal camera will not work.
Install dxMobile from the Google Play Store
There are three ways to install dxMobile (on your Android device) from the Google Play Store:
​ I have an existingGoogle account.
​ I want to create anew Google account using a newGmail address.
​ I want to create a new Google account using a current email address (not a Gmail address).
Install dxMobile Using an Existing Google Account
To install dxMobile on an Android device using an existing Google account:
1.​ On the Android device, on the Appsscreen, touch the Settingsicon.
2.​ On the Settingsscreen, in the Personalsection, touch Accounts.
3.​ TouchAdd Account.
4.​ On the Add an Accountscreen, touch Google. The Google Sign Inscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ On the Google Sign Inscreen, in the Email or Phonefield, type your Google account email or phone number.
6.​ Touch Next.
7.​ In the Passwordfield, enter your Google account password.
8.​ Touch Next. The Google Terms of Servicescreen appears, as shown:
9.​ Review the terms, and touch I agree. The existing Google Account displays in the Account list.
10.​ Press the Returnbutton until you return to the Appsscreen.
11.​ Touch the (Play Store) icon. The Google Play Storedisplays.
12.​ In the Searchfield, type “dxMobile,” as shown below. A list of apps displays.
13.​ Touch the TdxMobile application that displays the “TdxMobile” logo, as shown:
14.​ Touch Install. The dxMobile application is downloaded to your Android device.

p.ph: Install dxMobile byCreating a New Google Account Using a New Gmail Address

body.p: To install dxMobile on an Android device by creating a new Google account using a new Gmail address:
1.​ On the Android device, on the Apps screen, touch the Settings icon.
2.​ On the Settingsscreen, in the Personalsection, touch Accounts.
3.​ On the Accountscreen, touch Add Account.
4.​ On the Add an Account screen, touch Google. The Google Sign Inscreen appears.
5.​ Touch Create Account. The Create a Google Accountscreen appears, as shown:
6.​ In the First field, type your first name.
7.​ In the Last field, type your last name.
8.​ Touch Next. The Basic Informationscreen appears, as shown:
9.​ Enter your birth date and gender, and touch Next. The Choose Your Gmail Addressscreen appears. A list of suggested Gmail addresses displays, as shown:

10.​ Select a suggested Gmail address by touching the option button next to the desired address, or touch the “Create a different Gmail address” option button, and type a new address. “@gmail.com” is automatically appended to the address.
11.​ Touch Next. The Passwordscreen appears, as shown:
12.​ In the Password field, type a password (8 characters minimum).
13.​ In the Confirm field, type your password again, and touch Next. The Add Phone Number screen appears.
14.​ Touch Skip. The Privacy and Termsscreen appears.
15.​ Touch I agree. A confirmation screen appears, as shown:
16.​ Touch Next.
17.​ Press the Returnbutton to return to the Appsscreen.
18.​ Touch the (Play Store) icon. The Google Play Storedisplays.
19.​ In the Searchfield, type “dxMobile,” as shown below. A list of apps displays.
20.​ Touch the TdxMobile application that displays the “TdxMobile” logo, as shown:
21.​ Touch Install. The dxMobile application is downloaded to your Android device.

p.ph: Install dxMobile by Creating a New Google Account Using a Current Email Address (Not a Gmail Address)

body.p: If you want to install dxMobile on an Android device by creating a new Google account using a current email address (not a Gmail address), you must do so through your Internet browser. You cannot perform this task from the Settingson your Android device.
1.​ On the Android device, touch the Browser icon. The Internet browser displays.
2.​ In the Searchfield, typehttps://accounts.google.com/signup. The Create Your Google Accountscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ In the FirstNamefield, enter your first name.
4.​ In the Last Namefield, enter your last name.
5.​ Touch the Use My Current Email Address Insteadlink, as shown:
6.​ In the Your Email Address field, type your current email address, as shown:
7.​ In the Passwordfield, type a password. User 8 or more characters with a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols.
8.​ In the Confirmfield, type the password again.
9.​ Touch Next. The Verify Your Email Addressscreen appears, as shown:
10.​ Enter the verification code that was sent to your email address.
11.​ Touch Verify. The Welcomepage displays, as shown:
12.​ Enter your phone number, if desired.
13.​ Enter your birthdate, and gender.
14.​ Touch Next. The Privacy and Termsscreen appears.
15.​ Touch I Agree.
16.​ Press the Returnbutton to return to the Appsscreen.
17.​ Touch the (Play Store) icon. The Google Play Storedisplays.
18.​ In the Searchfield, type “dxMobile,” as shown below. A list of apps displays.
19.​ Touch the TdxMobile application that displays the “TdxMobile” logo, as shown:
20.​ Touch Install. The dxMobile application is downloaded to your Android device.
Log In to dxMobile
To log in to dxMobile:
1.​ On the android device, touch the (dxMobile) icon. The dxMobile Registrationscreen appears.
2.​ Type your Registration Code :dynamex
3.​ Touch Register. The Loginscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Type your Driver Number.
5.​ Touch Login. The Stop Summaryscreen appears, as shown:

Before you can update stop details and complete jobs, you must change your status from “out” to “in.” By logging in, you are letting the Dispatcher know that you are ready for work. When you are no longer available for work, you should log off to let the Dispatcher know your status.
To log in for Dispatch:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the down arrow in the title bar to display the Status Updatemenu, as shown:
2.​ Touch Login, as shown above. The Loginscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ In the Zip/Zonefield, type your zip code or zone.
4.​ Touch Submit. The Informationscreen appears indicating that you are logged in for Dispatch.
5.​ Touch OK.

A new feature of Managing of sessions with token has been added. Token expires/revokes access from the active session, if another user logs in with the same driver identification. This prevents multiple users by logging in with the same driver login id.

For example:If the Driver 1 is already logged in with the driver ID “123456” and at the same time another Driver 2 logs in with the same ID “123456”, then the Driver 1 session will expire automatically.
Note: Below is an example of user performing job on Stop Summary screen, but the session management feature has been applied for all scenarios where the user is performing any kind of activity.
1.​ When the Driver 1 logs in dxMobile with the ID – 8011, and performs a job on “Stop Summary Screen”, the screen shows no message of the Invalid token as shown:
2.​ However, as soon as Driver 2 logs in with the same driver ID - 8011, Driver 1 gets an error “Token Expired” and will not be able to perform further action on the device as shown:
Note:

If there are pending messages, or if the user is on the SCAN screen, or the stop is in arrived, or user is performing scans then the session does not expire. But when these actions are complete, and the user is on the STOP SUMMARY screen the session expires automatically.

The dxMobile application running on an Android device uses a built-in scanner for scanning packages. However, for large volume, we recommend using a 4820i/Socket scanner. Follow the steps in the Bluetoothsection below to pair your Android device to an external 4820i/ Socket scanner.
Bluetooth
To connect to the Honeywell 4820i/Socket scanner using the Bluetooth option:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the(Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Bluetooth, as shown:
4.​ The Bluetooth Servicescreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touchthe icon next to “4820i.” The Bluetooth Pairing Requestscreen appears.
6.​ Touch Pair.
7.​ Enter the Pairing Code“1234.” When the device is successfully connected via Bluetooth service, a Bluetooth symbol displays at the top of the Stop Summaryscreen, as shown:

DECS supports two types of routes: Distributionand Collection. Distribution routes are scanned at line-haul, loaded onto the Driver’s vehicle, and then delivered to the various locations along the route. XE "Distribution scanning:overview" Collection routes are scanned at various pickup locations, loaded onto the driver’s vehicle, and then delivered to a depot (see ??? for assistance on working with Collection routes.

Routes are generated in DECS from an Advanced Shipment Notification (ASN) file that is received from a Customer. The ASN file contains specific information for the route, such as stop details and the number of packages to be delivered.

The ASN file may or may not contain barcode information for each package that is to be delivered on the route. If barcode information is included, the route is considered to be “audited.” If no barcode information is sent with the ASN file, the route is “non-audited.” For more information about how “audited” and “non-audited” routes are handled, see Audited v e rsus Non-Audited Scans.

The dxMobile application keeps track of when packages are received, loaded, and delivered. The recording of scans, whether a route is audited or non-audited, and other dxMobile configurations are based on a Customer’s requirements. For this reason, you may or may not use all of the features described in this guide.
Audited Versus Non-Audited Scans
Scans are classified as either “Audited” or “Non Audited.”
Audited Scans
Audited scans occur when the Customer transmits an ASN file with barcode along with stop information. Auditing scan activity allows the dock worker or IC to verify package receive, load, or delivery.

When receiving, loading, and delivering packages, the DECS system checks to ensure that the barcode data in DECS matches what was scanned. The dock worker and Independent Contractor (IC) are responsible for verifying that there are no package overages or shortages. If there are, these are reported to the Customer via the Overage, Shortage, and Damage (OS & D) report.

The dxMobile application keeps track of packages that are scanned by displaying both the total packages requiring a scan and those that have already been scanned (e.g., 5/26). If there is an overage or shortage, a warning message appears indicating that a discrepancy has occurred. The barcodes of the missing packages are also displayed.
Non-Audited Scans

Non-Audited scans occur when the Customer submits an ASN file without barcode information. The total number of packages to be received and delivered is determined from the ASN file. Therefore, the dock worker and Driver know the exact number of packages to expect for the route.

p.ph: Quick Steps for Working with Routes

body.p: The following is a quick reference of the daily tasks required to complete a route. For more information about these tasks, refer to the chapters in this User’s Guide.

row.entry: On your Android device, log in to dxMobile. Then, log in for Dispatch.
For each package that you load onto your vehicle, scan the package barcode. If necessary, note reasons (Exceptions) why packages are not loaded.
Submit your arrival time, scan packages, enter a POD/signature/delivery code (if necessary), and depart the stop.
Log out of the dxMobile application, check for pending messages, and recharge your phone.

body.p: Load Packages

As the Driver, you are responsible for loading all packages for your route(s) into your vehicle. While loading the packages, you may be required to scan each package’s barcode. Whether or not a load scan is needed is based on Customer or branch requirements.
To load packages:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Load, as shown:
3.​ The Loadscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the desired route. The Load Scan screen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch the (Scan) icon. Or, if your device is paired to an external scanner, use the external scanner to scan a barcode.
6.​ Scan a barcode. An Infodialog box displays, as shown:
7.​ Click OK.
8.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo Last. The barcode number is removed.
9.​ (Optional) Touch Exceptionsto display a list of Exceptions, as shown:
10.​ Touch the item Exception that you want to define for a package. For item Exception descriptions, see Exceptions.
11.​ Touch Accept.
12.​ Repeat steps 4-10 for each barcode that you want to scan.
Note: To enter a barcode manually, on the LoadScan screen, touch the Scanfield to display a keyboard. On the keyboard, type a barcode, then touch the (Done) icon.
13.​ On the LoadScan screen, touch Done to return to the Stop Summaryscreen, as shown:
14.​ If you have not scanned all of the expected items, a Warningscreen appears, as shown:
15.​ If the load is complete, touch Yes to return to the Stop Summaryscreen. If the load is notcomplete, touch Noto return to the Load Scan screen and complete the load.
To view the Un-scanned Itemslist:
​ On the Load Scanscreen, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Un-scanned Items List, as shown:
​ The Un-scanned Itemslist appears, as shown:
To view the Scanned Itemslist:
​ On the Loadscreen, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Scanned Items List. The Scanned Itemslist appears, as shown:
Load Scan by Stop
To perform a load scan by stop:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the(Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Load, as shown:
3.​ The LoadScanscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the Load Scan:Select Stoptitle, as shown above. The Stop Listscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch the stop for which you want to load items. The stop’s Scanscreen appears, as shown:
6.​ (Optional) Touch the Exceptionsbutton, and select the item Exception that you want to define for a package.
7.​ Touch the (Scan) icon to use the internal camera on the phone to scan each barcode. Or, use a Bluetooth Scannerto scan each barcode.
8.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo Last. The barcode number is removed.
9.​ Touch Accept. Note: Skip this step if you are using a Bluetooth Scanner.

10.​ To load items for the next stop, touch Next Stop, and repeat steps 4 through 8 to scan items. If you want to load items for a stop that is notnext to the current stop, click the Load Scan: Select Stoptitle (as shown below), and select the stop (on the Stop Listscreen) for which you want to load items.
11.​ When you touch Next Stopor Load Scan: Select Stop, the following message displays indicating the number of items that were scanned, and the number of items that were expected, as shown:

12.​ If you scan an item that does notbelong to the current stop, the following message displays asking you if you want to accept the item as an overage on the current stop. If you accept the item as an overage on the current stop, no goods are moved. The load scan attaches to the goods, but the goods remain on the same stop.

13.​ When you scan an overage on a stop, the following warning message displays, “This item does not belong to any stops. Do you want to accept this item as an overage?” If you touch Yes, new goods are created on the stop.
14.​ After you have finished loading all goods on all stops, on the last stop, touch Next Stop. The Load Scanscreen appears, as shown:
15.​ Touch Doneto submit the Load for the route.
The Induction Scanprocess includes 3 steps:
Step 1: Create an Induction Scan Group[DECS Administration]
Step 2: Add an Induction Scan Groupto a Customer [DECS Administration]
Step 3: Perform an Induction Scan in dxMobile

p.ph: Step 1: Create anInduction Scan Group[DECS Administration]

body.p: To create an Induction Scan Group:
1.​ In DECS Administration, go to Main Menu> Distribution Menu >Scan Customer Group Maintenance.The Scan Customer Group Maintenancewindow appears.
1.​ Click the Add Scan Customer Grouplink, as shown:
1.​ The Scan Customer Group Maintenancewindow appears, as shown:
1.​ In the Name field, type “Induction Scan.”
1.​ In the Audit Receive Scanfield, click the drop-down arrow and select Yesif you want to audit the Receive Scan. Otherwise, select No.
1.​ In the Audit Induction Scanfield, click the drop-down arrow and select Yes. Note: The Induction Scanoption will display in dxMobile.
1.​ Click Save.

p.ph: Delete a Scan Group from a Customer

body.p: To delete a Scan Group from a Customer:
​ On the Scan Customer Group Maintenancepage, click the (Delete) icon next to the Scan Customer Groupthat you want to delete, as shown:
​ The Scan Customer Groupis removed from the Scan Customer Grouplist.

p.ph: Step 2: Add anInduction Scan Groupto a Customer [DECS Administration]

body.p: To add an Induction Scan Groupto a Customer:
1.​ In DECS Administration, go to Main Menu> Customer Maintenance. The Customer Maintenancewindow appears.
1.​ In the Account Numbercolumn, click the desired Account Number. The Edit Customerwindow appears.
1.​ Click the Distributionlink. The Distribution Setupwindow appears.
1.​ In the Scan Groupsection, click the drop-down arrow and select the Induction Scan Group.
1.​ Click the Add Scan Grouplink. The Induction Scan Groupdisplays in the Scan Grouplist, as shown:
1.​ Click Save.

p.ph: Delete a Customer from aScan Group

body.p: To delete a Scan Group from a Customer:
1.​ In DECS Administration, go to Main Menu> Customer Maintenance. The Customer Maintenancewindow appears.
2.​ In the Account Numbercolumn, click the desired Account Number. The Edit Customerwindow appears.
3.​ Click the Distributionlink. The Distribution Setupwindow appears.
4.​ In the Scan Groupsection, click the (Delete) icon next to the Scan Groupthat you want to delete, as shown:
The Scan Groupis removed from the Scan Grouplist.
If a Driver is added to a Customer that has a Scan Groupdefined, the Scan Groupdisplays for Induction, Receive, Hold, and Release.
Note: The Scan Groupdisplays for Receive, Hold, and Release regardless of the Audit Receive Scansetting (yes or no) in DECS Administration.
Note: The Induction Scanoption only displays in dxMobile if the Audit Induction Scanfield is set to “Yes” in DECS Administration. (For more information, see Step 1: Create an Induction Scan Group).
To perform an Induction Scan:
1.​ In dxMobile, touch the (Menu) icon, and then touch Induction, as shown:
2.​ The Induction Listscreen appears, as shown:
2.​ Touch the desired account. The Inductionscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ On the Inductionscreen, you can:
​ Scan the items
​ Set the item exceptions
​ Undo the last scan
​ Scan the overages
​ View scanned and unscanned items.
3.​ On the Inductionscreen, scan an overage. A list of Customers in the Scan Groupdisplays, as shown:
4.​ Touch the Customer to whom you want to assign the goods.
5.​ Repeat steps 2-3, until you have scanned all of the overages.
6.​ Touch Done. An Information screen appears, as shown:

Note: If the Induction Scanis performed withinthe branch, both Inductionand Receive Scansare generated with identical time stamps. If the Induction Scanis performed outsideof the branch, only Induction Scansare generated, and the branch generates Receive Scans.
To view Scan Eventsin Order Entry:
1.​ In Order Entry, locate the desired order.
2.​ Click the Packagebutton, as shown:
3.​ The Package Dialogwindow appears, now click the desired package.
4.​ Click the Scanbutton. The Scan Eventswindow appears, as shown:
Use Receive Scanto record package barcodes that are received from the Customer.Receive Scanis typically performed by a dock worker.
To perform a Receive Scan:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Receive, as shown:
3.​ The Receivescreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the desired account. The ReceiveScanscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch the (Scan) icon.
6.​ Scan a barcode.
Note: If you are performing an audited Receive Scan, an information dialog box appears for routed and un-routed barcodes:

Note: You do not have to touch OKeach time you scan an item. You can continuously scan items, and the Info dialog box automatically refreshes and displays the information associated with the scanned barcode.
7.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo Last. The barcode number is removed.
8.​ (Optional) In the Exceptionlist, touch the item Exception that you want to define for a package. For item Exception descriptions, see Exceptions.
9.​ Touch Accept.
10.​ Repeat steps 4-8 for each barcode that you want to scan.
11.​ Touch Done.
Use Hold Scanto record package barcodes that need to be held at the depot for a period of time. Hold Scanis typically performed by a dock worker.
Note: To view the Holdoption in dxMobile, the Hold Scan option must be set to “Yes” in DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance>Distribution Setup> Device Configuration >Hold Scan.
To perform a Hold Scan:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Hold, as shown:
3.​ The HoldListscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the desired account. The Holdscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch the Hold for Daystext box and enter the number of days for which you want to hold the scanned items.
6.​ Touch the (Scan) icon.
7.​ Scan a barcode.
8.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo. The barcode number is removed.
9.​ (Optional) If you want to define an Exception for a package, touch Exceptions. In the Exceptionslist, touch an item Exception. For item Exception descriptions, see Exceptions.
10.​ Touch Accept.
11.​ A package validation check has been added upon scanning on HOLD. This gives the user more visibility if the scanned barcode is an overage or if it belongs to another customer etc.
12.​ If a wrong barcode which does not belong to the customer is scanned, it notifies the driver that the package does not belong to the scan group as selected.
13.​ The user can choose to Cancel or Accept the same.
14.​ Repeat steps 4-9 for each barcode that you want to scan.
15.​ Touch Done.

Use Consolidation Scanto group held packages into one or more pallets. A palletis a collection of items that are for future delivery to a single stop, route, or Driver. They may also be items that are being held for other reasons.
To perform a Consolidation Scan:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Consolidation, as shown:
3.​ The ConsolidationListscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the desired account. The Consolidationscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch the (Scan) icon.
6.​ Scan a barcode.
7.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo. The barcode number is removed.
8.​ (Optional) If you want to define an Exception for a package, touch Exceptions. In the Exceptionslist, touch an item Exception. For item Exception descriptions, see Exceptions.
9.​ Touch Accept.
10.​ Repeat steps 4-8 for each barcode that you want to scan.
11.​ Touch Done. A Warningscreen appears, as shown:
12.​ Touch Yes.
Use Release Scanto scan the package IDs of items that you want to release from the depot. Release Scanis typically performed by a dock worker.
Note: To view the Releaseoption in dxMobile, the Release Scan option must be set to “Yes” in DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance>Distribution Setup> Device Configuration >Release Scan.
To perform a Release Scan:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Release, as shown:
3.​ The ReleaseListscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the desired account. The Releasescreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch the (Scan) icon.
6.​ Scan a barcode.
7.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo. The barcode number is removed.
8.​ (Optional) If you want to define an Exception for a package, touch Exceptions. In the Exceptionslist, touch an item Exception. For item Exception descriptions, see Exceptions.
9.​ Touch Accept.
10.​ Repeat steps 4-8 for each barcode that you want to scan.
11.​ Touch Done.
At this point, all packages are loaded into your vehicle, and you are ready to leave the depot and begin your route.
Perform the following steps to complete the stops on a route:
1.​ Select andsta rt a route
2.​ HYPERLINK \l "_View_Stop_Details"View st opdetails
3.​ Submit your stop arrival time
4.​ Scanpackages
5.​ Enter aPOD(if needed)
6.​ Enter a signature(if needed)
7.​ Enter aDelivery Code(if needed)
8.​ Departa stop
Select and Start a Route
At the start of each day, routes that are assigned to you are sent to your phone. You must select and start the route that you want to complete.
Note: Your phone receives updates every minute.
To select and start a route:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the desired route, as shown:
2.​ The Stop Listscreen displays a list of stops defined for the route, as shown:

3.​ Touch Start. If the LoadScanoption is enabled for a route (in DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance> Distribution Setup> Device Configurationsection), you are required to sign for the route. The Sign for Routescreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Enter a signature.
5.​ Touch Submitto start the route. The signature and the depot depart time are sent to DECS.

6.​ If the Load Scanoption is disabled in DECS Administration, the Start Routescreen appears indicating that you are leaving the depot and are about to start a route, as shown below. Touch Submitto start the route.
Stop Type Codes
1.​ To the right of the stop number, a stop code (a letter) displays that indicates the type of stop, as shown:
2.​ The table below describes the Stop Type Codes:
Stop StatusCodes
To the right of each stop, a status code (a letter) displays that represents the current status of the stop, as shown:
The table below describes the Stop Status Codes:

row.entry: Indicates that the stop is open and pending. When a stop has this status, it means that the Driver has not yet viewed the stop. An “O” displays when using theShow All Stops,Show Pending, andShow New Stopsfilters.
Indicates that the Driver has viewed the stop. A “V” displays when using theShow All StopsandShow Pendingfilters.
Indicates that the Driver has arrived at a stop. The stop has anArrivestatus. An “A” displays when using theShow All StopsandShow Pendingfilters.

Indicates that the Driver has completed the stop. When a stop is in this status, you can go back and review the stop details. To make a change to the stop, you must first perform anUndo Departure. This changes the status back toArrive. A “C” displays when using theShow Completedfilter.
Indicates that the Driver has entered an exception for the stop. This means that the stop has a “Damaged” or “Refused” exception defined. An “E” displays when using theShow Exceptionfilter.

body.p: To view stop details:
1.​ On the Stop Listscreen, touch the desired stop whose details you want to view, as shown:
2.​ The Stop Detailscreen appears, as shown:
​ The Stop details display and include the Order Number, Address, Contact Number, Service, Vehicle, Time, Branch, References, andSpecial Instructions.
Submit Your Stop Arrival Time
When you arrive at a stop, you must submit your Arrival Time.
​ To submit your Arrival Time:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, touch the (Arrive) icon, as shown:
2.​ Or, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Manual Arrive.
3.​ The Arrival Timedisplays on the Stop Detailscreen in the Actualfield, as shown:
Undo a Stop Arrival
To undo a stop arrival:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, touch the (Undo) icon, as shown:
2.​ Or, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Undo Arrive.
3.​ The Informationscreen appears asking “Undo arrive?” as shown:
4.​ Touch Yesto undo the stop arrival.
Scan Packages
If your Android device is not connected to an external scanner, follow the steps below to scan packages.
Note: You must submit an arrival time before the (Scan) icon will display. (See Submit YourStop Arrival Timefor instructions).
To scan packages:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the Scan section, and touch the (Scan) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Scanscreen appears.
3.​ Touch the (Scan) icon.
4.​ Scan a barcode.
5.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note: To undo (delete) the last scan, touch Undo. The barcode number is removed.
6.​ (Optional) In the Exceptionlist, touch the item Exception that you want to define for a package. For item Exception descriptions, see Exceptions.
7.​ Touch Accept.
8.​ Repeat steps 2-6 for each barcode that you want to scan.
Note: Touch the (Return) icon to return to the Stop Detailscreen.
To view the Un-scanned Itemslist:
1.​ On the Scanscreen, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch
Un-scanned Items List. The Un-scanned Itemslist appears, as shown:
2.​ Touch an un-scanned item to view it on the Scanscreen.
To view the Scanned Itemslist:
1.​ On the Scanscreen, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Scanned Items List. The Scanned Itemslist appears, as shown:
2.​ Touch a scanned item to view it on the Scanscreen.
Item Exceptions for Un-Scanned Packages

A new feature has been added which does not allow the driver to depart without scanning or accounting for all packages on a stop. On delivery scan if package barcode is not available, the driver has the option of putting an item exception for the un-scanned barcode.
-​ The below scenario explains the feature:
Say there are 3 packages to be scanned on a stop, but only 1 package is available for the scanning then the other 2 packages should be set with item exceptions.

p.ph: Setting on DECS Administration> Exception Maintenance

body.p: -​ If a stop has expected package(s) and the Delivery Attempt on Item Exception is set to true, then this feature is enabled.

(i)​ On SCAN screen, POD/UPDATE/ DEPART is disabled. It will not be enabled until all packages have been accounted for. The driver scans one package, then dxMobile will not let the driver either to Update, POD or Depart, and is forced to click on “Done” tab.
(ii)​ When the driver clicks on “Done”, they are presented with the screen, where they can select the Item Exception for unscannable packages and submit.

(iii)​ After the exceptions are submitted, the driver is notified of all the packages are being accounted for, with which he will be able to proceed to Depart. The POD/UPDATE/DEPARTgets enabled after all packages have been accounted for.
If you are completing a pickup stop, you do not need to enter a POD or signature, go to Depart a Stop.
If you are completing a delivery stop, follow the instructions in the Enter a PODand Enter aSignaturesections below.
Enter a POD
Note: You must submit an arrival time before the (Sign) icon will display.(See Submit Your Stop Arrival Timefor instructions).
To enter a POD:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the Sign section, and touch the (Signature) icon, as shown:
The Signaturescreen appears.
2.​ In the PODfield, type the POD Name.
3.​ Touch Done.
4.​ Touch the (Return) icon to return to the Stop Detailscreen.
Enter a Signature
If the delivery stop requires a signature, you can allow the Customer to sign your device’s screen or you can take a picture of the Customer’s signature.
Allow a Customer to Sign Your Device Screen
To allow the Customer to sign your device’s screen:
1.​ On the Signaturescreen, in the Signaturesection, allow the Customer to sign the screen, as shown:
2.​ Touch the (Return) icon to return to the Stop Detailscreen.
Take a Picture of a Customer’s Signature
To take a picture of a Customer’s signature:
1.​ On the Signaturescreen, in the Signaturesection, touch the Cameraicon, as shown:
2.​ The camera displays.
3.​ Take a picture of the Customer’s signature. The Signaturescreen appears and displays the picture of the Customer’s signature, as shown:
4.​ Touch the (Return) icon to return to the Stop Detailscreen.
Clear a Signature
To clear a signature:
​ On the Signaturescreen, touch theTrash Can icon, as shown:
​ The Signaturesection is cleared.
A new flag POD Image has been added in the customer device configuration. There are 3 scenarios as explained below for this feature:
​ If POD Image flag is set to “Not required”, then Signature and POD are not required, the driver will be able to procced to Depart without signature/POD.

​ If the POD Image flag is set to “Signature required or Delivery image required”- it won't force the driver to put Signature or POD, it will only show the warning message, but the driver can proceed to Depart.

​ If POD Image is set to “Delivery Image Only”- It will force the driver to Capture the POD image. Once the POD image is captured, the driver can save the Image and will be able to proceed for Depart

A new flag has been added in DECS Administration > Device Configuration that lets you create new order creation on overage scanning. If set to yes, and driver scans an overage, selects the customer, and DEPARTS then DECS creates the overage order for another customer.
On DECS Administration > Device Configuration, a flag has been added to allow overage order creation:
​ Case: Allow Overage Order Creationflag is set as “No”
On DEPART screen:
1.​ Touch the (Scan) icon to use the internal camera on the phone to scan each barcode. Or, use a Bluetooth Scannerto scan each barcode.
2.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen.
Note:If the scanned package belongs to another stop on the same route, dxMobile prompts the message “Package does not belong to the current stop”and will not let the driver to scan the package.
​ If Allow Overage Order Creationflag is “Yes”
On DEPART screen:
1.​ Touch the (Scan) icon to use the internal camera on the phone to scan each barcode. Or, use a Bluetooth Scannerto scan each barcode.
2.​ Touch the icon to return to the Scanscreen
​ The dxMobile shows the list of other customer(s) (only those customers to whom flag is set to Yes on DECS side). If driver selects another customer, then on DEPART DECS creates an Overage order.
-​ After the driver DEPARTS from the stop, then behind the scenes an overage on-demand order is created for the customer.
Enter a Delivery Code
If you are required to enter a Delivery Codefor a stop, you can enter it on the Signaturescreen.
Note: Delivery Code options are only available if a Delivery Code Profileis defined in DECS Administration. (DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance> Distribution Setup> Delivery Code Profilefield.
To enter a Delivery Code:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the Sign section, and touch the (Signature) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Signaturescreen appears.
3.​ Touch the Delivery Codefield, the Delivery Codescreen appears and displays the Delivery Codeoptions, as shown:
4.​ Touch a Delivery Code.
5.​ Touch the (Return) icon to return to the Stop Detailscreen.
Depart a Stop
Note: You must submit an arrival time before the (Depart) icon will display. (See Submit Your Stop Arrival Timefor instructions).
To depart a stop:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the Depart section, and touch the (Depart) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Departscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ Touch Submit.
Undo a Departure
To undo a departure:
​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the UndoDepart section, and touch the (UndoDepart) icon, as shown:
Or, on the Stop Detailscreen, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Undo Departure, as shown:
Exceptions
Exceptions may occur when packages are picked up or delivered. There are two types of exceptions: Stop Exceptionsand Item Exceptions.
Stop Exceptionsare reasons why you were not able to arrive at a stop, or you were not able to pick up or deliver packages.
Item Exceptionsare related to packages.
For example “Damage” is used if a package is damaged, or “Refused” is used if a Customer refuses to accept the package.
The table on the next page describes standard Stop Exceptionsand Item Exceptions.
Note: Exceptions vary by Customer, so you may have fewer or different exceptions available on your device.

row.entry: Un-able to arrive at the stop due to an incorrect address
Un-able to gain access to the delivery location
Un-able to arrive at the stop, because the Customer provided in-correct route information
All packages were delivered with damage
Un-able to arrive at the stop, because the Driver’s vehicle broke down
Un-able to delivery packages to the stop, because it was a holiday
Delivered packages to the stop late, because the packages arrived late to the Distribution Center
Un-able to arrive at the stop, because the Driver had in-correct route information
Un-able to arrive at the stop, because the Driver did not have access to the delivery location
Un-able to delivery packages to the stop, because the receiver was not available to receive them
The delivery location is not able to receive the packages due to lack of space
Un-able to complete the stop, because all packages were refused by the Customer for a reason other than damage
Un-able to complete the stop, because all packages were refused by the Customer due to damage
Un-able to deliver packages to the stop, because no one was there to sign for the packages
Un-able to arrive at the stop due to traffic
Un-able to arrive at the stop due to inclement weather
The packages that the Driver attempted to deliver were not intended for the delivery location
One or more packages are damaged
Additional packages exist over the expected number of packages
The Customer refused the package, because of damage

body.p: You can define an Exception for a stop, and undo an Exception from a stop.
Define a Stop Exception
Note: You must enter a Stop Exception before you submit an arrival time for the stop.
To define an Exception for a stop:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, touch the (Exception) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Exceptionscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ Touch a Stop Exception that you want to define for the stop.
4.​ An Informationscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch Yes.
Undo a Stop Exception
You can undo a Stop Exception that is defined for stop.
To undo a Stop Exception:
​ On the Stop Detailscreen (for a stop that has an Exception defined), touch the (Exception) icon, as shown:
​ Or, on the Stop Detailscreen, touch the (Menu)icon, and then touch Undo Exception.
​ The Exception is no longer defined for the stop.
A new featureForce Capture Image on Stop Exception has been added. This feature requires the driver to capture the Image of the Stop exception along with the Stop Exception Code.
Note:This applies to only those exceptions for which Delivery Attempt = Yes. If the Delivery Attempt = No, then driver can enter the Stop Exception code, but there is no need to capture the image.
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, touch the (Exception) icon, as shown. Touch the Stop Exception that you want to define for the stop.
2.​ An Informationscreen appears, as shown below:
3.​ Click Yesand the Camera will be engaged.
The driver has the option to Save the image by clicking “OK” and proceed further or else a “Reset” option is given, if the image is not being captured properly.
Late Stop Exceptions

When departing a stop, if you are required to enter a Late Stop Exceptionand your actual depart time is later than the expected depart time, the text “You are Late” displays, and you must define a Late Stop Exception.

Note: Late Stop Exceptionsare only required if the “Require Late Exception” option is enabled in DECS Administration. (DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance> Edit Customer> Service Tab > Require Late Exceptionfield).
To define a Late Stop Exception:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the Depart section, and touch the (Depart) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Departscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ The Departscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ In the Actual Departfield, the current time is displayed. If you want to change the actual depart time, type the time (HH:MM).
5.​ In the Late Stop Exceptionlist, select a Late Stop Exception.
6.​ Touch Submit.
You can add an Item Exception, and undo an Item Exception. For information on how to do this, see Scan Pac kages.
The following filter options allow you to view specific stops on the Stop Listscreen:
​ Location Scan
​ Search
​ Show All Stops
​ Show Pending
​ Show Completed
​ Show Exception
​ Display Stop Name
​ Display Stop Addr
Some Customers require you to perform a Location Scanwhen you arrive at a stop. The Location Scanfeature allows you to scan a location barcode.

You can search for a stop by using the Location Codeassigned to the stop. After you scan the location barcode, the matching stop displays in the Stop List. You can access the Location Scanfeature from the Stop Summaryscreen and the Stop Listscreen.

Note: The Location Scanfeature is only available if it is enabled in DECS Administration. (In DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance> Distribution Setup, the Location Scanfield must be set to Yes).
To scan a location barcode:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Location Scan, as shown:
3.​ Scan the location barcode.
4.​ Touch the icon to return to the Stop Listscreen.
You can search for a stop by Manifest.
To search for a stop:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Search, as shown:
3.​ The Searchscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Enter a Manifest Code.
5.​ TouchGoTo. The stop that matches the search criteria displays.
Show All Stops
The Show All Stopsfeature allows you display all stops in the Stop Listscreen.
To display all stops:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show All Stops, as shown:
3.​ On the Stop Listscreen, all stops display.
Show Pending
The Show Pendingfeature allows you to display only stops that have an “Open” (pending) status.
To display only open (pending) stops:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show Pending, as shown:
3.​ On the Stop Listscreen, only open (pending) stops display.
Show Completed
The Show Completedfeature allows you to display only the stops that you have completed.
To only display stops that you have completed:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show Completed, as shown:
3.​ On the Stop Listscreen, only the stops that you have completed display.
Show Exception
The Show Exceptionfeature allows you to display only the stops that contain a stop exception.
To only display stops that contain a stop exception:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show Exception, as shown:
3.​ On the Stop Listscreen, only the stops that contain a stop exception display.
The Display Stop Namefeature allows you to display the stop name for each stop in the Stop Listscreen.
To display stop names in the Stop Listscreen:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Display Stop Name, as shown:
3.​ On the Stop Listscreen, the stop name is displayed for each stop, as shown:
The Display Stop Addrfeature allows you to display the stop address for each stop in the Stop Listscreen.
To display stop addresses in the Stop Listscreen:
1.​ On the Stop List screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Display Stop Addr, as shown:
3.​ On the Stop Listscreen, the stop address is displayed for each stop, as shown:
The sections below describe features that you can use when you are working with jobs.
You can edit the number of pieces for a stop if you have rights to do so. (In DECS Administration> Customer Maintenance> Distribution Setup, the Change Piecefield must be set to Yes).
Note: You cannot update the Piecesfield if:
​ The piece count that you enter is equal to the Expected Piececount.

​ The piece count from the database does not match the Expected Piececount. (In this case, we assume that the Driver did not manually input the piece count, and the actual piece count is the default piece count. The piece count was changed in DECS, but has not been received by dxMobile).
Note: You must submit an arrival time before the (Update) icon will display. (See Submit Your Stop Arrival Timefor instructions).
To update the number of pieces for a stop:
1.​ On the Stop Detailscreen, scroll down to the Update section, and touch the (Update) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Updatescreen appears, as shown:
3.​ In the Piecesfield, type the number of pieces for the stop. Note: If the stop has a delivery and a pickup, enter the number of pieces in each Piecefield.
4.​ Touch the (Return) icon to return to the Stop Detailscreen.

When you are assigned new routes or when routes are updated, Dispatch automatically transmits the routes to your phone. If for some reason you do not receive the new routes or updates to existing routes, you can use the Re-Download Routesfeature. New routes display at the top of the Stop Summarylist.
To re-download your routes:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Re-Download Route, as shown:
4.​ The Warningscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch Yesto clear the Distribution route data and re-download routes.
To re-download your jobs:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Re-Download Jobs, as shown:
4.​ The Warningscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch Yesto clear the Distribution jobs data and re-download jobs.

If changes have been made to the dxMobile configuration, you will need to download the new configuration. When you use the Refresh Allfeature, all data is cleared, and the new configuration takes effect.
Note: You can also update the dxMobile configuration by signing out of the dxMobile application, and then signing back in.
To refresh all data and the dxMobile configuration:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Refresh All, as shown:
4.​ The Warningscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch Yesto clear all data and re-download the dxMobile configuration.

The dxMobile application automatically transmits all messages on your device (such as text messages or completed jobs) to the DECS server. If the connection to DECS is lost, these messages are queued until the connection is established again. They are then automatically sent to DECS.

If for some reason the queued messages are not automatically uploaded to DECS when the connection is restored, you can use the Flush Messagesfeature to send them to DECS. There must be a connection to DECS, before the messages can be sent.
To flush messages:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Flush Messages, as shown:
4.​ All messages are sent to DECS.
To connect to Honeywell 4820i/Socket scanner using the Bluetooth option:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen,touch the(Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Bluetooth, as shown:
4.​ The Bluetooth Servicescreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touchthe icon next to “4820i.” The Bluetooth Pairing Requestscreen appears.
6.​ Touch Pair.
The Aboutfeature displays information about the version of dxMobile that is currently running.
To display dxMobile version information:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen, touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch About, as shown:
4.​ The Aboutscreen appears, as shown:
The Supportfeature helps the user to raise any query or assistance if needed.
To need any assistance, go to:
1.​ On the Stop Summary screen, touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
3.​ Touch Support, as shown:
4.​ Fill the details in Supporti.e. Date, Issue type, Approximate Time, User’s Email and Descriptionas shown:
Note:
1.​ By default, date will be display on the current day but you can change the date by touch on the drop an down button.
2.​ To choose type of issue, toch on the drop and down buttona nd choose appropriate issue as shown:
3.​ User’s Email is Mandatory to raise any query.
​ After filling all the details, touch the send file.
Note: The Re-do Signatureoption is only available for completed stops.
To re-do a signature for a completed stop:
1.​ Locate the completed stop whose signature you want to re-do.
2.​ Go to the Stop Detailsscreen.
3.​ Touch the (Re-do Signature) icon.
The Signaturescreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the Trash Canicon, as shown above.
5.​ Allow the Customer to sign the screen. Or, touch the Cameraicon and take a picture of the Customer’s signature.
6.​ Touch the (Return) icon.
On the Stop Detailsscreen, you can capture an image (using the Cameraoption) that is then attached to the selected stop.
To capture an image:
1.​ After you arrive at a stop, on the Stop Detailsscreen, click the Cameraicon, as shown:
The camera is enabled.
2.​ Capture the image.
3.​ Click OKto accept the image. Note: Click Cancelif you want to reject the image and re-take it.
On the Stop Detailsscreen, the picture count is updated, as shown:

p.ph: View the Images that are Attached to Stops

body.p: In Order Entry, you can view the images that are attached to stops.
1.​ In the Order Entrywindow, click Documents, as shown:
The Order Documentwindow appears, as shown:
The Stop Addressand Stop Numberare displayed for each image.
2.​ In the Order Documentlist, click the image that you want to view.
3.​ Click Opento view the document.
The Order Entryfeature allows you to create orders in dxMobile.

Note: The Order Entryoption is only available if your device is configured to allow you to create orders. In DECS Administration> Main Menu> Customer Maintenance> Edit Customer> Distributionlink, in the Device Configurationsection, the Allow Order Creationfield must be set to Create Route.
To enter a new order:
1.​ On the Stop Details screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Order Entry, the order entry screen appears:
3.​ In the Namefield, type a name for the order.
4.​ In the Block Nofield, type a Block Number.
5.​ In the Suitefield, type a Suite Number.
6.​ In the Streetfield, type a Street Address.
7.​ In the Cityfield, type a City.
8.​ In the Zipfield, type a Zip Code.
9.​ In the Piecesfield, type the number of pieces in the order.
10.​ In the Curr Wtfield, type the current weight of the pieces.
11.​ In the Item Scanfield, type a barcode, and touch Accept. Or, touch the (Scan) icon, and scan a barcode. Touch the icon to return to the Order Entryscreen.
Note: To clear the Item Scanfield, touch Undo.
12.​ If you want to enter another order, touch Save and Create New. Repeat Steps 1-11 to create another order.
Or,
If you are finished entering orders, touch Save and Complete, as shown:

p.ph: Transfer Packages to Another Stop on the Route

body.p: A Transferis a where the Driver, while delivering packages to a stop, receives a request to deliver one or more packages to another stop on the same route, but not to the depot stop. This request may occur when another store is low on inventory and needs the goods or goods were sent to the wrong stop. The Driver uses the Transferfeature to perform this task. A new on-demand job is created. The Driver continues the route. When he arrives at the transfer stop, he completes both the route stop and the transfer job.
To transfer packages on a stop to another stop on the route:
1.​ On the Stop Listscreen, touch the stop whose packages you want to transfer. The Stop Detailsscreen appears.
2.​ Press the(Menu)button on your device.
3.​ Touch Transfer. The Transferscreen appears.
4.​ Touch the stop to which you want to transfer the packages. A Warningscreen appears.
5.​ Touch Yes.
You can join multiple stops (that have the same postal code) so that items that are scheduled to be delivered to the same postal code can be delivered together.

For example, Stops 2, 3, and 10 all have items that need to be delivered to the same postal code. You can join Stop 2 to Stop 3 and Stop 10. When you complete Stop 2, dxMobile also completes Stop 3 and Stop 10 with the same POD and image signature.
To join stops:
Note: You cannot join a stop that is in “Arrived” status.
1.​ On the Stop Listscreen, touch the stop that you want to join with another stop. The Stop Detailsscreen appears.
2.​ Touch the (Menu)icon.
3.​ Touch Join, as shown:
4.​ The Join Listscreen appears, as shown:
5.​ Touch one or more stops to join. A check mark displays next to each stop that you touch.
6.​ Touch Submit.
Un-Join Stops
To un-join stops:
Note: You cannot un-join a stop that is in “Arrived” status.
1.​ On the Stop Listscreen, touch the stop that you want to un-join. The Stop Detailsscreen appears.
2.​ Touch the (Menu)icon.
3.​ Touch Join, the Join Listscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ Touch the stops that you want to un-join. The check marks are removed.
5.​ Touch Submit.

p.ph: Create Routes Based on Scanning 2-D Barcodes

body.p: You can allow routes to be built from dxMobile based on scanning 2-D barcodes. The 2-D barcodes contain information about the package, address information, contact information, special instructions, etc. The driver/vendor scans the barcodes, and then sends the information to the DECS server. The server then processes the information and creates Routes.
To enable this feature, perform the following steps:
1.​ In DECS Administration > Distribution Setup, define the Data Formatas Paycheck 2D Scan Route Data. See Data Format Optionfor details.
2.​ In DECS Administration > Device Maintenance, enable the Create System Routeoption. See Enable the Create RouteOptionfor details.
3.​ In DECS Administration > Device Maintenance, define the Route Plan Scopefield. See Define the Route Plan ScopeOptionfor details.
1. Data Format Option [DECS Administration]
To allow routes to be built from dxMobile based on scanning 2-D barcodes, you must first define the Data Formatfield (in DECS Administration> Distribution Setup).
To define the Data Formatfield:
1.​ Go to DECS Administration> Main Menu> Customer Maintenance.
2.​ Click the ac
3.​ count number for the customer whose Data Formatfield you want to define. The Edit Customerwindow appears.
4.​ Click the Distributionlink. The Distribution Setupwindow appears.
5.​ In the Data Formatfield, click the drop-down arrow, and select Paycheck 2D Scan Route Data.
6.​ Click Save.
2. Enable the Create RouteOption [DECS Administration]
After you have defined the Data Format, you must enable the device to allow dxMobile to create Routes. A Route is created by the DECS system based on the 2-D barcode information.
To enable a device to create Routes:
1.​ Go to DECS Administration> Main Menu> Driver Menu > Device Maintenance.
2.​ Click the name of the driver whose device you want to edit. The Edit Device window appears.

3.​ In the Create System Routefield, click the check box to place a check mark in the field. When this option is checked, an option called “Create Route” displays on dxMobile. The DECS server creates routes based on the customer’s route assignment. To turn off the option, click the check box to remove the check mark.
4.​ Click Save.

When the Data Formatoption is set to Paycheck 2D Scan Route Data(in DECS Admin), and the Create System Routeoption is enabled (in DECS Admin), the Create Routeoption displays on the Android device as shown below:
3. Define the Route Plan ScopeOption[DECS Administration]

In Device Maintenance, you can configure a device to download only route plans assigned to the driver, all route plans, or no route plans. This feature works with the Create System Routefeature described above.
To define the Route Plan Scopeoption for a device:
1.​ Go to DECS Administration> Main Menu> Driver Menu> Device Maintenance.
2.​ Click the name of the driver whose device you want to edit. The Edit Devicewindow appears.
3.​ In the Route Plan Scopefield, click the drop-down arrow and select one of the following options:
​ None– No routes are displayed on the phone.
​ Own Route Plans– dxMobile displays only route plans that are assigned to the driver.
​ All Route Plans– dxMobile displays all route plans defined for the branch.
4.​ Click Save.
When the Route Plan Scopefield has been defined in DECS Administration, the Route Plans display on the device according to the option that you chose, as shown below:
1.​ Select the desired route.
2.​ Scan the 2-D barcodes.
3.​ Select Done. The barcode information is sent to the DECS server for route creation.
A package validation check has been added upon scanning. This gives the user more visibility, if the scanned barcode is an overage or if it belongs to the another customer etc.
Below is the example, when scanning a wrong barcode which does not belong to the customer, it notifies the driver that the package does not belong to the scan group as selected.
-​ The user can choose to Cancel or Accept the same.

The dxMobile application allows you to send a text message to Dispatch, and receive text messages from Dispatch. For example, Dispatch may send you a text message requesting your current status. Or, you may want to send a text message to Dispatch informing them that you are delayed.
You can view specific messages by filtering the Messageslist. You can create messages using a free form or a canned form. You can also reply to messages and delete messages.
A message has a status of either “V,” which indicates that you have read the message, or “N,” which indicates that you have not yet read the message.
To view your messages:
1.​ In the dxMobile application, touch the (Messages) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Messagingscreen appears and displays the messages that Dispatch has sent to you, as shown:
3.​ Touch a message. The message displays, as shown:
To delete a single message:
1.​ On the Messagingscreen, touch the message that you want to delete. The message displays.
2.​ Touch Delete, as shown:
3.​ The message is deleted from the Messagelist.
To reply to a message:
1.​ On the Messagingscreen, touch the message that you want to reply to. The message displays.
2.​ Touch Reply, as shown:
3.​ The Messaging – Replyscreen appears, as shown:
4.​ In the Replysection, use the phone’s keypad to type a message.
5.​ Touch Send.
You can filter the Messageslist to view specific messages.
Show All
To show all of your messages (read and unread) in the Messagelist:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show All, as shown:
3.​ All of the messages that Dispatch has sent to you display in the MessagesList.
Show New
To show all of the new messages that you have not yet read:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show New, as shown:
3.​ All of the new messages that you have not yet read display in the MessagesList.
Show Viewed
To show all of the messages that you have already viewed:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show Viewed, as shown:
3.​ All of the messages that you have already viewed display in the MessagesList.
Show Replied
To show all of the messages to which you have replied:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Show Replied, as shown:
3.​ All of the messages to which you have replied display in the MessagesList.
To delete all of the messages in the Messageslist:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the (Menu)icon.
2.​ Touch Delete All, as shown:
3.​ All of the messages in the Messageslist are deleted.
You can create two types of messages: Free Formand Canned. A Free Formmessage is a message that you create and send. A Cannedmessage is a pre-defined message that you can select and send.
Create and Send a Free FormMessage
To create and send a Free Formmessage:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the(New) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Free Msg/Canned Msgscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ In the Free Formsection, use the phone’s keypad to type a message.
4.​ Touch Send.
Create and Send a Canned Message
To create and send a Cannedmessage:
1.​ On the Messaging screen,touch the(New) icon, as shown:
2.​ The Free Msg/Canned Msgscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ Touch CannedMSG, as shown:
4.​ In the Canned Messagesection, select the desired canned message.
5.​ Touch Send.
To power off/exit the dxMobile application:
1.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the down arrow in the title bar to display the Status Updatemenu, as shown:
2.​ Touch Power Off/Exit, as shown above. The Exitscreen appears, as shown:
3.​ Touch Yesto exit the dxMobile application.
If errors occur when GPS information is sent from the dxMobile device to DECS, the following error codes may display:

row.entry: GPS is turned on,but GetPosition contains exceptions.
GPS is turned on,GetPosition is normal, but the latitude/longitude values are ”0” or failed to return values.
GPS is deactivated in user configuration.

body.p: How to Send the Log Files?
To send the log files:
1.​ On the Android device, touch the (Application) icon.
2.​ On the Stop Summaryscreen, touch the (Menu)icon.
3.​ Touch Others. The Utilitiesscreen appears.
4.​ Touch Support, as shown:
5.​ Fill the details in Supporti.e. Date, Issue type, Approximate Time, User’s Email and Descriptionas shown:
Note:
1.​ By default, date will be display on the current day but you can change the date by touch on the drop an down button.
2.​ To choose type of issue, toch on the drop and down buttona nd choose appropriate issue as shown:
3.​ User’s Email is Mandatory to raise any query.
​ After filling all the details, touch the send file.
TForce Final Mile
14881 Quorum Drive, Suite 700
Dallas, TX 75254
USA
